isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES - INJECTION NOZZLE TESTING

important.para: IT IS ADVISABLE TO TEST NOZZLES BEFORE CLEANING THEM.

step1.para:
Prior to nozzle and holder disassembly, the undisturbed assembly should be connected to a hand test pump ZTSE4045-A ( Figure 9.50
) and checked for opening pressure and tip leakage.

important.para: READ THE INSTRUCTIONS WHICH ACCOMPANY NOZZLE TESTER ZTSE4045-A PRIOR TO TESTING THE FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES. FOLLOW THOSE OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS.

step1.para: Prepare Test Pump For Making Tests.

step2.para: Fill the nozzle tester with Viscor 1487C* calibration fluid. Operate pump handle to expel air from pump and outlet pipe. Operate pump until solid fluid (without air bubbles) flows from end of outlet pipe.

step1.para: * Calibration fluid meets SAE J967 (latest revision) and ISO 4113 standards.

step2.para:
Connect injection nozzle to test pump, as shown in Figure 9.50
. Avoid "cross threading". The connector nut must be tightened securely with an open end wrench.

note.para: Any leakage at the connector nut will invalidate injection nozzle testing. Do not confuse leakage at the connector nut with return fuel leak-off.

step2.para: Bleed air from nozzle. Operate pump for several quick strokes to expel (bleed) air from injection nozzle. Fluid should discharge from the hole in the nozzle tip.

caution.para: KEEP HANDS AWAY FROM NOZZLE DISCHARGE. FLUID DISCHARGING FROM THE NOZZLE UNDER HIGH PRESSURE CAN PENETRATE THE SKIN AND CAUSE INFECTION. MEDICAL ATTENTION SHOULD BE PROVIDED IMMEDIATELY IN THE EVENT OF SKIN PENETRATION.

important.para: EXTENSIVE TESTING BY NAVISTAR INTERNATIONAL TRANSPORTATION CORP. HAS CONCLUDED:

para.emph: 1. PINTLE TYPE NOZZLES USED ON THE 7.3 L DO NOT REQUIRE SPRAY PATTERN ANALYSIS.
2. "CHATTER" IS NOT A CAUSE FOR ACCEPTANCE OR REJECTION OF A PINTLE TYPE NOZZLE.
3. RETURN FUEL LEAKAGE CHECK IS NOT REQUIRED.
4. PROPER USE OF THE NOZZLE TESTER ZTSE4045-A IS CRITICAL WHEN TESTING NOZZLE OPENING PRESSURE AND TIP LEAKAGE.
5. AS A BASIC GUIDELINE, IF THE ENGINE PERFORMANCE CONCERN DOES NOT EXHIBIT AN ENGINE COMBUSTION KNOCK, NOZZLE TESTING IS NOT REQUIRED.
